intro: Costera ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf costera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and related species. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
